title: fix(security):Path Traversal Bug
content:
Unsanitized input from CLI argument flows into io.ioutil.ReadFile, where it is used as a path. This may result in a Path Traversal vulnerability and allow an attacker to read arbitrary files.
See this fix : https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/pull/3573
Impact
There is a path traversal vulnerability in the source code of fabric
steps: Identify the CLI argument that is passed unsanitized to the io.ioutil.ReadFile function in the Hyperledger Fabric source code.
Craft a malicious input that includes path traversal sequences (e.g., '../') to access arbitrary files outside the intended directory.
vuln_description: The vulnerability is a path traversal issue where unsanitized input from a CLI argument is directly used in the io.ioutil.ReadFile function, allowing an attacker to read arbitrary files on the system by manipulating the input to include path traversal sequences.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to discover as it involves a direct flow of unsanitized input into a file read operation, a common and well-documented security issue. The attack does not require multiple components, complex interactions, or novel logic.
